question_text: How would you design a serverless image processing pipeline for user-uploaded content on GCP?
hook_text: Learn how to build a highly scalable, cost-effective serverless image processing pipeline on Google Cloud!
cta_text: Follow for more real-world GCP architecture insights!

answer_sections.title: Ingest & Trigger
answer_sections.text: User uploads to Cloud Storage. Event triggers Cloud Functions via Pub/Sub.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Users upload images directly to Cloud Storage. This event triggers a Cloud Function, published through Pub/Sub, ensuring reliable asynchronous processing.

answer_sections.title: Process & Analyze
answer_sections.text: Cloud Functions process images. Resize, watermark, analyze with Vision AI. Store in Firestore.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Cloud Functions perform image resizing, watermarking, and advanced analysis using the Vision AI API. Processed outputs and metadata are then stored in Firestore.

answer_sections.title: Serve & Monitor
answer_sections.text: Serve processed images via Cloud CDN. Monitor pipeline with Cloud Monitoring and Logging.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Serve processed images efficiently via Cloud CDN. Monitor pipeline health and performance with Cloud Monitoring and Logging for proactive alerts.

diagrams.title: Delivery & Observability
diagrams.dsl:
[[Cloud Storage (Processed)]] -> [Cloud CDN] -> (Users) 
 [Cloud Functions] --> "Logs" [Cloud Logging] 
 [Cloud Functions] --> "Metrics" [Cloud Monitoring]
